intro: Psychotria eminiana var. heteroclada, commonly known as the "Bolivian Psychotria," is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia and Peru. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
